abstract: Deer strikes have fallen, but the costs of repairing your car after hitting a deer have risen.
snippet: Deer strikes have fallen, but the costs of repairing your car after hitting a deer have risen.
lead_paragraph: Our colleagues at the Bucks blog are reminding us that this is the peak time for deer-car collisions - October and November - because fall is mating season. State Farm says that deer vs. automobile crashes are on the decline, but they're still a problem. And the costs of repairing vehicles after a strike have risen. An annual analysis of the insurer's auto claims estimates there were 1.09 million collisions between deer and automobiles from July 2010 to June 30, 2011, down 7 percent from the prior year and 9 percent from three years ago. Read more »

headline.main: Deer-Car Collisions Are Less Frequent, but More Costly
